result.execSummary:
The defendant Priscilla M Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to contact the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Def to pay fees directly to DOC.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Def to have NO contact w/P.D. or her residence.
  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen @ any law enforcement agency provided they agree to communicate your compliance w/Ashland Co w/in 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Priscilla M Martinez

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Priscilla M Martinez not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.; No FDS provided; DOC rec civil judgment; ADA notes def has not completed provisions of JOC, has not paid anything; Ct finds bad faith effort in paying, Ct extends prob for 1 year or until shows good faith and completed counseling whichever comes first;

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def P Martinez appears via phone.  Atty has not gotten plea ques bk fr def but did send bk to him.  Agreemt - plea chg, w/h & Prob 1 yr, AODA, absol, pres, UA, No cont w/Patricia Deragon or her resid, cog, $10 fine + csts, dna.  Waives rt to be in ctrm.   Ct 1 - Plea N/C.  Ct accept plea & finds def G of: Crim tress to dwell - 943.14(2), 939.62 & adm rptr.  VRL/complied.  SENT:  w/held & Prob 1 yr, Cont DOC/Ashlnd w/in 24 hrs, cond's AODA, absol, pres, UA, No cont w/Patricia Deragon or her resid, COG, $10 fine + cst = $488.88 thru DOC, DNA spec w/in 7 days @ another law enformt prov they agree to communicate your compliance w/Ash Co.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 3, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Priscilla M Martinez in court via phone with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA comments there is an agreement. Atty comments sent def the PQ and other information for def to sign. Atty sent another copy to def now. Asking court to adj hearing after first of year.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Priscilla M Martinez in court via phone with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ct tired calling Def.  Atty comments rec'd offer that will accept depending Discovery martial. Has the right to be here in person, can appear by Phone.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant Priscilla M Martinez not in court. Bench warrant already issued. not why we are here. end of hearing
